title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:20 <mflorea> has quit  
00:44 <jvdrean> has quit  
01:16 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
01:40 <DrLou> has quit

02:45 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki

04:05 <DrLou> has quit  
04:09 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
04:15 <pturcotte> has quit  
04:15 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
05:26 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
06:24 <DrLou> has quit  
06:47 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:01 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
07:03 <Denis> has quit  
08:17 <el-morte> has joined #xwiki  
08:18 <el-morte> hello, i have a little question and i found no answers in mailing lists or forums  
08:18 <@cjdelisle> I can try to answer it  
08:19 <el-morte> our xwiki uses ldap to authenticate users, but we'r german and some of the names have umlaute. those people can connect, but i cant change rights or put them in new groups  
08:19 <el-morte> charset is utf-8  
08:20 <el-morte> not connect, i meant login ^  
08:20 <el-morte> hi cjdelisle, maybe you have an idea what i can do?  
08:21 <@cjdelisle> I can look and see if the problem with special characters in usernames is known, I have a feeling it is.  
08:24 <el-morte> thats nice, where are you looking for known problems? next time i could myself :) this website is for me still a bit confusing  
08:24 <@cjdelisle> The registration function prevents users from registering with usernames which contain special characters (the first/last name can contain anything)  
08:24 <@cjdelisle> This is why I think there is a known limitation with usernames and special characters.  
08:26 <@sdumitriu> Hm, it should work though  
08:26 <@sdumitriu> Make a jira  
08:26 <el-morte> and do you have an idea how i could disable it? to change whole ad would be to much work and my colleague would hate me..  
08:27 <el-morte> what is a jira?  
08:27 <@sdumitriu> Report an issue on http://jira.xwiki.org/  
08:29 <el-morte> ah okay, thank you, i'll try it  
08:29 <sdumitriu> has quit  
08:30 <@cjdelisle> Yup, I don't see any issue about that so it makes sense to create one.  
08:39 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
08:44 <el-morte> has quit  
08:54 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:57 <cjdelisle> has quit  
09:08 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:31 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
09:44 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:38 <silviar> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:27 <cjdelisle> has joined #xwiki  
12:46 <evalica> has quit  
12:57 <vmassol> has quit  
13:13 <+sburjan> good morning guys  
13:16 <tmortagne> has quit  
13:27 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
13:48 <+sburjan> who is the release manager of 3.2 ?  
13:53 <+sburjan> guys, the latest snapshot is totally broken. I get the largest stack trace I've ever seen in my life. And it doesn;t start  
13:54 <+sburjan> it starts after like 3 minutes of continous stack errors  
13:54 <+sburjan> can someone take a look ?  
13:57 <+tmortagne> sburjan: downloading latest snapshot  
13:58 <+sburjan> org.reflections.ReflectionsException: could not create Dir using org.reflections.vfs.Vfs$DefaultUrlTypes$2 from url jar:file:/home/sorinello/Desktop/XWiki/XWiki%203.2/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-3.2-SNAPSHOT/webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib/netty-3.2.4.Final.jar!  
13:58 <+tmortagne> sburjan: remove the white spave  
13:58 <+tmortagne> space  
13:58 <+tmortagne> in your path  
13:58 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:59 <+tmortagne> "XWiki 3.2"  
13:59 <+sburjan> ok, let me try that way  
13:59 <+tmortagne> jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6939  
14:00 <+tmortagne> and introduced by XWIKI-6765  
14:00 <+sburjan> yes, works now  
14:00 <+tmortagne> though is was already in M2 actually, will reopen it and close the other as duplicate  
14:01 <+sburjan> I gign't gotthis in M2  
14:01 <+sburjan> and the path contained a space  
14:01 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
14:01 <+sburjan> ok, I'm starting to test  
14:03 <+tmortagne> sburjan: I know is was not in M2, that's what I just said :)  
14:09 <+sburjan> I guess you'll have to use a hack in order to fix this. or switch to the old method  
14:09 <+sburjan> File.toURL() method  
14:09 <+jvdrean> hi, I'm searching for the command allowing to publish a jar artifact in a external maven repo, does anyone remember where to find it ?  
14:10 <+jvdrean> I guessed it changed on xwiki.org since we switched to nexus but I have a plain old repo I'd like to deploy to  
14:10 <+tmortagne> sburjan: I'm not sure yet, puting back the previous version would be a pain since all APIs changed  
14:11 <+tmortagne> I think I will try to rewrite there method until they fix it  
14:11 <+jvdrean> ok found it deploy:deploy-file  
14:11 <pturcotte> has quit  
14:23 <sburjan> has quit  
14:36 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
15:16 <+tmortagne> sburjan: lets commit one of the ugliest hack I even made...  
15:17 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
15:17 <+tmortagne> it's a pity they don't create tags when they release I would have deployed a patched version of reflections 0.9.5  
15:19 <+sburjan> let's hope they will fix it in a elegant way  
15:19 <+sburjan> or at least they'll fix it  
15:19 <+tmortagne> I gave them a way to fix it hope they apply it quickly  
15:19 <+tmortagne> and quickly release the 0.9.6  
15:20 <+tmortagne> I'm only doing the hack for extension manager but we have the same issue with rendering unit test, hope nobody is coding in a folder with white space...  
15:20 <+sburjan> let's hope it's also critical for them as it's for us :) IMO not allowing a white space is very bad, because no one expects that  
15:22 <+tmortagne> it's not excatly ralated to white space specifically but they forget to unescape the URL path so they try to open file with %20 in they name  
15:22 <+sburjan> so this package sees system paths as URL's ?  
15:24 <+tmortagne> what happen is that they get all the files to scan using the classloader in which they are listed as URLs and then extract the FS style file name from the URL but they forget to unescape URL special characters while doing it  
15:24 <+sburjan> understand  
15:24 <+sburjan> which was is the best way if I want to know who and when added some feature on platform ? Like permalink generation on comments  
15:25 <+tmortagne>  jar:file:/home/sorinello/Desktop/XWiki/XWiki%203.2/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-3.2-SNAPSHOT/webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib/netty-3.2.4.Final.jar!  ------>  /home/sorinello/Desktop/XWiki/XWiki%203.2/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-3.2-SNAPSHOT/webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib/netty-3.2.4.Final.jar  
15:25 <+tmortagne> sburjan: I would find finding the related jira issue  
15:25 <+sburjan> yehy should have unescaped the %20, right ?  
15:26 <+tmortagne> yep  
15:26 <+tmortagne> s/find finding/by finding/  
15:27 <+sburjan> damn it, I'm not finding it on jira  
15:28 <+tmortagne> sburjan: I think it was sdumitriu  
15:29 <+sburjan> yes, but I never find these things, and I'd like to know them so I know who committed, them, etc  
15:30 <+tmortagne> the other way is to look at the file history in github if you know which file has been modified for this feature  
15:31 <+sburjan> I'm really missing a search feature on github  
15:32 <+tmortagne> I think there is one in github  
15:35 <+sburjan> found it :)  
15:35 <+sburjan> it was marta  
15:35 <+tmortagne> ok that's why  
15:35 <+tmortagne> (was filtering on sdumitriu)  
15:37 <+sburjan> I really have to learn to use github search  
15:38 <+sburjan> also it seems that create page behavior is changed. it doesn't add the space webhome as parent, it adds the current page you're on when clicking "add" as a parent  
15:38 <+tmortagne> sburjan: maybe it's not you, vmassol complained a lot about github search  
15:38 <+tmortagne> (never used it myself)  
15:39 <+sburjan> yes, me neither, but I have to keep up with the features and commits so I won;'t confuse them with bugs :)  
15:42 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:47 <+tmortagne> hmm I can't create a wiki, I get an error on activity stream mapping when updating the schema  
15:48 <+tmortagne> http://pastebin.com/6kQev43x

18:36 <+Denis> sdumitriu: Hi, seems we do not agree on keeping analytics.vm for now  
18:36 <@sdumitriu> Hi  
18:36 <@sdumitriu> WDYM?  
18:37 <@sdumitriu> I saw in the issue description:  
18:37 <@sdumitriu> 2. Change analytics.vm to be enabled by default if a client ID is specified in the preferences  
18:37 <@sdumitriu> And it's still commented out  
18:37 <+Denis> I mean that I do not depend on analytics.vm and I left it behind since some user may be used to it  
18:37 <@sdumitriu> Ah, OK  
18:37 <@sdumitriu> So the JSX does everything  
18:37 <+Denis> yes  
18:38 <@sdumitriu> Sorry for the noise  
18:38 <@sdumitriu> I'll look more carefully at the commit  
18:38 <jvdrean> has quit  
18:38 <+Denis> letter we may even imagine to package that as en simple extension  
18:38 <+Denis> s/letter/later  
18:38 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
18:38 <@sdumitriu> Something to put in the extension repository  
18:41 <+Denis> yes, it is a self contained document, quite easy to deploy, even on an old version of XWiki, requirements are just to support admin config and JSX, but the translation are not self contained (this is worse part)  
19:21 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
19:29 <evalica1> has quit  
19:31 <Enygma`> has quit  
19:58 <vmassol> mflorea: hi  
19:58 <vmassol> I see "Currently no. The width and height of the gallery container is computed from the image max width/height, which are hard-coded in resources/uicomponents/widgets/gallery/gallery.css" in a comment you posted on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Gallery+Macro  
19:58 <vmassol> however when I tried using the flickr rss feed with the gallery macro, the gallery width/height is very large compared to the images it contains  
19:59 <vmassol> so it doesn't seem to use the max width/heigh of cotained images  
19:59 <vmassol> is that a bug or is it that I didn't understand your comment?  
20:01 <lpereira> has joined #xwiki  
20:12 <+mflorea> vmassol: when I said "image max width/height" I was referring to the CSS max-width and max-height whose values are hadcoded, and based on their (hard-coded) values I compute the rest of the gallery size. In other word, if you want to change the gallery size, you just have to change the values of the max-width/height  
20:12 <+mflorea> have to go now  
21:35 <vmassol> lots of stuff failing in the build  
21:36 <vmassol> seems we have a corrupted zip: Caused by: java.util.zip.ZipException: The JAR/ZIP file (/home/hudsonagent/.m2/repository/c3p0/c3p0/0.9.1/c3p0-0.9.1.jar) seems corrupted, error: error in opening zip file  
21:36 <vmassol> removing it  
21:38 <vmassol> starting platform build manually  
21:39 <vmassol> Denis: build failure: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-xmlrpc/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-xmlrpc/228/testReport/org.xwiki.test.xmlrpc.confluence/OrphanedPageTest/Checking\_orphans\_for\_XWiki\_GoogleAnalyticsCode/  
21:39 <vmassol> can you fix it?  
21:39 <vmassol> Denis: and here too: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/241/testReport/org.xwiki.test.webstandards.framework/DefaultValidationTest/Validating\_XHTML\_validity\_for\_\_space\_XWiki\_u002C\_page\_GoogleAnalyticsCode\_executed\_with\_credentials\_Admin\_admin/  
21:39 <vmassol> seems like you forgot to run some functional tests… :)  
22:01 <vmassol> has quit  
22:09 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
22:25 <+Denis> vmassol: sorry, I try to fix...  
22:25 <vmassol> thanks Denis
